intro: Perictenia anomala, commonly known as the narrowleaf pellitory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, often found in desert regions. Perictenia anomala is adapted to withstand drought and is considered a low-maintenance plant in xeriscaping.
